verses.roman:
tayos tad adbhutaṁ vīryaṁ
niśāmya pura-vāsinaḥ
tejaḥ prāgalbhyaṁ rūpaṁ ca
menire vibudhottamau

synonyms: tayoḥ—of Them; tat—that; adbhutam—amazing; vīryam—heroic deed; niśāmya—seeing; pura-vāsinaḥ—the residents of the city; tejaḥ—Their strength; prāgalbhyam—boldness; rūpam—beauty; ca—and; menire—they considered; vibudha—of demigods; uttamau—two of the best.
translation: Having witnessed the amazing deed Kṛṣṇa and Balarāma had performed, and seeing Their strength, boldness and beauty, the people of the city thought They must be two prominent demigods.
